Name: Espresso Profeta
Notes: Beautiful brick courtyard and strong coffee, but multiple reviews confirm there are effectively zero outlets, so it fails the non‑negotiable power rule.

Name: Intelligentsia Coffee (Abbot Kinney)
ReasonRemoved: Insufficient outlets for serious laptop work.
Notes: Famous Venice coffee bar with great beans but long‑standing reputation for having almost no plugs; best treated as a quick coffee stop, not a workspace.

Name: Menotti’s Coffee Stop (Boardwalk)
ReasonRemoved: Very limited seating and no dependable wifi.
Notes: Legendary espresso bar that deliberately prioritizes fast turnover and social bar‑style energy over laptop camping.

Name: Santa Monica Public Library (Main) – Vibe-Only Tier
ReasonRemoved: Not a social/body‑doubling vibe; kept only as deep‑focus option in main DB.
Notes: Amazing for silent work but excluded from any “cowork vibe” filter; use only when you explicitly want library‑level quiet.

Name: Metric / The Motoring Club
ReasonRemoved: Private car club/event space, not a general laptop workspace.
Notes: Fun atmosphere but not reliably open as a remote‑work café for non‑members; outside clean geofence/use‑case.

Name: Hilltop Coffee + Kitchen (Slauson)
Notes: Strong community café but fails the west‑of‑La‑Cienega boundary constraint.

Name: Good People Coffee Co.
ReasonRemoved: Outside specified neighborhoods and geofence focus.
Notes: Great shop on Santa Monica Blvd but not within the targeted Westwood/Santa Monica core for this dataset.

Name: Cafe Solar
Notes: Older work‑friendly reviews exist, but current listings flag it as closed, so it’s removed from the active map.

Name: Blue Bottle Coffee (Abbot Kinney & Platform)
ReasonRemoved: Quick‑turnover spaces with minimal seating and scarce outlets.
Notes: Other LLM audit plus community threads consistently describe Westside Blue Bottle locations as sterile, seating‑light and not laptop‑friendly enough for this list.

Name: Blue Bottle Coffee (Playa Vista Brickyard)
ReasonRemoved: Ambiguous wifi/outlet experience and quick‑turnover design.
Notes: Some sources mention wifi and floor outlets, but brand‑wide inconsistency and quick‑turnover layout keep it out of a rigorously reliable worklist.

Name: The Conservatory for Coffee, Tea & Cocoa
Notes: Multiple sources describe it as a deliberate "no wifi" zone meant for conversation, so it fails the basic infrastructure bar.

Name: Urth Caffé (Santa Monica)
ReasonRemoved: Too chaotic and hostile to laptop camping during peak hours.
Notes: Often packed with tourists and brunch traffic; outlets are hard to secure and staff are known to discourage long laptop stays.
